history.content: I hate to be a wet blanket (or whatever sad metaphor), but grades you earn after graduation won't impact your GPA. However, they will show that you have the capacity to earn higher grades, and you can take our CS classes through Extension's concurrent enrollment program, if that's what you mean. And people looking at your transcript will know that your Fall 2020 grades were earned during a difficult period (which you can also emphasize in your statement of purpose). Berkeley certainly isn't the only place in the world to get a master's in CS!

I'm taking all classes for a letter grade (my mistake haha). I planned on graduating this semester but I'm scared I might end up with a 2.96 after finals. Should I take a couple classes remotely next semester to get above a 3.0? How important is it?

I have a full time offer and start in January, but am considering getting an MBA in the future. I'd like to go to grad school for CS, but my GPA would be too low to get a Berkeley master's in CS. Can I take CS classes even after I graduate?
history.subject: How important is a 3.0 GPA?
